alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Colquitt; Decatur; Grady; Mitchell; Seminole; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jackson and northeastern Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, Gadsden, north central Liberty and northeastern Leon Counties in Big Bend of Florida, Decatur, Grady and southeastern Mitchell Counties in southwestern Georgia, Thomas and northwestern Brooks Counties in south central Georgia, southeastern Seminole County in southwestern Georgia and southern Colquitt Counties in south central Georgia through 215 PM EDT/115 PM CDT/... At 130 PM EDT/1230 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whigham, or near Cairo, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Moultrie, Thomasville, Quincy, Havana, Bainbridge, Cairo, Midway, Ochlocknee, Pavo, Coolidge, Whigham, Chattahoochee, Riverside, Greensboro, West Bainbridge, Sneads, Gretna, Grand Ridge and Berlin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and south central and southwestern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Brooks; Colquitt; Decatur; Grady; Mitchell; Seminole; Thomas
